creator: sauli.karhu@codeonline.com
text:
1.7 Beta: Empty "Number of threads" field causes exception.

Easy to reproduce: Delete the default "1" and you get the exception.

I'm unable to reproduce this -- can anyone else? .. Submitter - can you attach
the exception? 

I'm running the same platform as you, and if I delete the default "1", switch
off of that property page and then back to it, the "1" remains. If I set it to
anything but a number, I get an error message immediately (not an exception,
just a dialog box telling me the input is invalid)..
creator: jim@boutcher.com

text:
Here is the exception in detail:

read.java:131)
        at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy(EventDispatchThre
ad.java:98)
        at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:93)
        at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run(EventDispatchThread.java:85)
creator: sauli.karhu@codeonline.com
mstover1@apache.org
text: I can't reproduce.  Appears to be fixed.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
